title: Auxiliary Set
description: Auxiliary set is a file set that hosts raw data files (e.g. FASTQs) resulting from sequencing of nucleic acids of a sample that are a proxy to some vital information and necessary for the analysis of an associated measurement set. Auxiliary sets usually would not provide any information about the transcriptome or the genome of the sample in question. For example auxiliary sets would include the sequencing of barcodes that correspond to the elements introduced into cells, or sequencing of guide RNA coding sequences in the cells. The files hosted in the auxiliary sets are relevant for the analysis, but they by themselves are not assessing much of the biology of the sample being analyzed.

file_set_type.description: The category that best describes this auxiliary file set.
file_set_type.comment: File set type describes the content of the construct library set. Cell hashing barcode sequencing is the antibody barcoding of cell batches. Cell sorting is data collected during fluorescence activated cell sorting. Circularized RNA barcode detection is reporter detection (such as for MPRA) through sequencing circularized barcoded RNA molecules. gRNA sequencing is sequencing data of guide RNAs. Lipid-conjugated oligo sequencing is lipid- and cholesterol-modified oligonucleotides. Quantification DNA barcode sequencing is sequencing data of barcodes, such as for MPRA. Variant sequencing is sequencing data of genomic DNA sequences with variants introduced.
